imagehandling.headerhandling

Class TextOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • imagehandling.headerhandling.TextOptions

  • public class TextOptions
extends java.lang.Object
    The TextOptions are used to define the Search and Return options for the getAttribute methods of volume and Image.

    The Static int values, are 7,8,9. If you use the return expression, than you should avoid these values.

    Author:
    Dominik Ridder

      static int ATTRIBUTE_VALUE
      TextOptions.ATTRIBUTE_NUMBER represents the Attribute value in the search option, as well as in the return expression.

    • Method Detail

      • setReturnExpression

        public void setReturnExpression(java.lang.String returnexp)
        The ReturnExpression defines, what the getAttribute method should return. For example:

        TextOptions topt = new TextOptions();

        topt.setReturnExpression(TextOptions.ATTRIBUTE_NUMBER + " "+ TextOptions.ATTRIBUTE_NAME + ": "+ TextOptions.ATTRIBUTE_VALUE);

        System.out.println(vol.getAttribute("echo"));

        Output:

        0018,0081 Echo Time: 3.3

        0018,0086 Echo Numbers(s): 1

        0018,0091 Echo Train Length: 1

        Parameters:
        returnexp - The String, that represents the search option

      • getReturnExpression

        public java.lang.String getReturnExpression()
        This method returns the String, which defines the output of a getAttribute method.
        Returns:
        The current ReturnExpression

      • getSearchOptions

        public java.util.HashSet<java.lang.Integer> getSearchOptions()
        This method returns the search options. The HashSet is not copied.
        Returns:
        The Options, listed in a HashSet<Integer>

      • setSearchOptions

        public void setSearchOptions(int[] textoptionsvalues)
        With this method, you can set all search options directly.
        Parameters:
        textoptionsvalues - The options that should be used as the search options.

      • addSearchOption

        public void addSearchOption(int textoptionvalue)
        This method adds a search option to the search option HashSet.
        Parameters:
        textoptionvalue - The option that should be added to the search options.

      • removeSearchOption

        public void removeSearchOption(int textoptionvalue)
        This method removes one text option attribute from the search options HashSet.
        Parameters:
        textoptionvalue - The option that should be removed from the search options.
